abstract: A Miami-based German financial manager has been arrested as part of a criminal investigation into German hedge fund K1, which is suspected of bilking numerous banks out of about $400 million, The Miami Herald reported.
snippet: A Miami-based German financial manager has been arrested as part of a criminal investigation into German hedge fund K1, which is suspected of bilking numerous banks out of about $400 million, The Miami Herald reported.
lead_paragraph: A Miami-based German financial manager has been arrested as part of a criminal investigation into German hedge fund K1, which is suspected of bilking numerous banks, including Barclays Capital, JPMorgan Chase, BNP Paribas and Société Générale, out of about $400 million, The Miami Herald reported, citing sources familiar with the probe.

headline.main: U.S.-Based Manager Arrested in K1 Probe

abstract: JPMorgan Chase raised concerns about Galleon Group‘s chief, Raj Rajaratnam, and his associates as far back as 2001, The Financial Times reported.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase raised concerns about Galleon Group‘s chief, Raj Rajaratnam, and his associates as far back as 2001, The Financial Times reported.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase  raised concerns about Galleon Group‘s chief, Raj Rajaratnam, and his associates as far back as 2001, The Financial Times reported, citing an internal company document seen by the newspaper.

headline.main: JPMorgan Said to Have Galleon Concerns in 2001
